content: some more or let out some twist by spinning the spindle in the direction you spun your single when the yarn hangs in a loose u shape without twisting on itself it is balanced unhook it and wind it onto the spindle place the loop and the single on the hook let out a length of single take the loop off the hook and pull the single through you ve just formed a very loose crochet chain stitch unwind and pull through as much single as you like place the yarn on the hook and spin in the plying direction test for balance as before and when balanced wind onto the spindle repeat this step until you have plied all the single wind off into a big loop i use an old box to get my loop but i hear a niddy-noddy is handy and finish the yarn in hot soapy water or whatever technique is appropriate to your fiber pulse warmer this pulse warmer may be made larger or smaller as needed by working more row the fabric should not quite fit around the whole wrist mine took about 11 yards of yarn i used an h 5 50 mm hook to match the roughly worsted weight yarn your mileage may vary make a slip_stitch leaving a few inches on the tail chain 12 single_crochet in the second stitch and across chain 1 and turn single_crochet in the back loop across 12 times tie off yarn but do not cut pull remaining yarn through the last stitch of the foundation chain leaving a 1 1/2 inch gap between the two sides pull through the fourth single_crochet from the first expanse of yarn leaving a gap continue working the yarn across creating a zigzag finish by pulling yarn through the first chain of the foundation chain and tie the ends together in a small bow trim ends as needed
